data.title: Terry Farrell – Bio, Height, Age, Why Did She Retire, Where Is She Now?
data.meta_description: Terry Farrell is another member of the long list, like Kate Upton and Jolene Blalock, to have moved on to an acting career after modeling. Thanks to her
data.text:
Terry Farrell is another member of the long list, like Kate Upton and Jolene Blalock, to have moved on to an acting career after modeling. Thanks to her decision to integrate the two careers, fans of the Star Trek franchise were able to appreciate her acting skills in the television series Star Trek: Deep Space Nine (1993-1998) where she played the role of Jadzia Dax.

A native of Cedar Rapids, Iowa, she is also known for her portrayal of the character Regina Kostas on the comedy series Becker (1998-2002). Read on to learn more about her career and why she chose to get out of it.

Terry Farrell Biography (Age)

Terry Farrell was born Theresa Lee Farrell to KayCarol Christine (née Bendickson) and Edwin Francis Farrell, Jr. in Cedar Rapids, Iowa on November 19, 1963. At a young age, his parents divorced and his mother married David W. Grussendorf who adopted Farrell and his brother.

As a high school student, Farrell went through a growth spurt that saw her stand almost 6 feet tall. This made everyone around her encourage her to try modeling as she also had the body in line with the height. Farrell then took some photos of herself which she submitted to the Elite modeling agency in New York in hopes of signing a contract. As the situation deteriorated, the agency invited him to New York shortly after he turned 16. Two days after her purchase, she had signed an exclusive contract with the women’s magazine Mademoiselle.

Terry Farrell spent 18 months modeling for Mademoiselle as well as Italian, German and American versions of Vogue before deciding to add the actor to his resume. She took acting lessons and then landed her first major appearance in the TV series Paper Dolls (1984) where she played the role of a model. After the series ended, Farrell appeared in various television series and movies before landing her first feature film role. Back to School (1986).

Not being satisfied with the kind of work she was doingIn 1989, Farrell returned to study acting with renowned actress and acting teacher Stella Adler. The move seemed to have paid off as Farrell, a few years later, was offered the lead role in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, his most notable role to date.

Why did she withdraw?

In 2002, after Terry Farrell married actor BrianBaker, she chose to retire on an acting basis to focus on caring for her family. She and Baker, better known as Sprint Guy because of his recurring role as the spokesperson for the telecommunications network in its television commercials, agreed to move away from Los Angeles, California, to Hershey , in Pennsylvania, in order to get away from the things that could cause their marriage to fail, which she had witnessed in Hollywood.

Farrell revealed in an interview that she had come from a broken home and seen her mother marry and divorce many times, and didn’t want it for herself or the children she was planning to bring into the world. Farrell and Baker then enjoyed a 13-year marriage during which they welcomed a son, Max, before their divorce in December 2015.

Two years after her divorce, Farrell signed a relationship with TV executive Adam Nimoy during which she came out of retirement to start her career over. On March 26, 2018, the two spouses exchanged their vows and became husband and wife.

Where is she now?

Terry Farrell has returned from retirement following her divorce from her first husband, who is set to appear in the Star Trek: Renegades video fan movie. She is also set to play the same role in several episodes of the fan film series which this time would not include the Star Trek name for legal purposes and would only carry the Renegades name.

With so much free time, Farrell can be seen attending Comic-Con and Star Trek conventions with his son Max, who is also a fan of the show.

the size

With a very impressive height of 6 feet 0 inches (1.82 m), it is no wonder that Terry Farrell was able to make a career as a model. She further weighed around 60kg and was 37-37 inches tall for bust waist and hips.
